Dear Ms. Harding:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 07/02/2021.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation, Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days
from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12306 Application request.
(4) An agency shall document that the licensee has been
given an application for renewal of the license not less than
60 calendar days before the expiration date of the license.
One of the three current foster home files reviewed indicated the licensee was not
given a application for renewal at least 60 calendar days before the expiration date
of the license. In this example the license had an expiration date of 09/02/20 and
the letter that was sent with the application for renewal was dated 08/04/20. The
license was subsequently renewed timely.
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(4) An agency shall document placement specifications
consistent with the information contained in the reevaluation.
The placement specifications shall include all of the following:
(a) Age,
(b) Gender,
(c) Race,
(d) Number of children preferred by the family,
(e) Characteristics of children best served by the home,
(f) Children who may not be placed in the home. The child's
racial, ethnic, and cultural identity, heritage, and background
may only be considered if an assessment of the individual child
indicates that such consideration is in the best interests of the
child.
One of the three current foster home files reviewed contained an annual
reevaluation report dated 05/26/2021 that did not identify the placement
specifications as required by this rule. In this example the worker included a
statement that the recommendation was for no change in the license instead of
identifying the specifications.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation, an
agency shall complete a written report that includes all of the
following information:
(d) Dates and places of contacts, names of persons
interviewed, and names of the interviewers. If children are
interviewed, their last names shall not be included in the report.
3

Two of the three special evaluations reviewed identified the last name of children
that were placed and interviewed as a part of the evaluation. The intake dates of
these special evaluations were 04/07/21 and 04/25/21 respectively.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(b) Inform the foster parent, in writing, that he or she has a
right to have his or her written response included as an
attachment to the report required by subrule (5) of this rule.
Two of the three special evaluations reviewed did not include documentation the
foster parent was informed in writing that they had a right to have their written
response included as an attachment to the report. The intake dates of these special
evaluations were 04/07/21 and 04/25/21 respectively. This is a repeat
noncompliance from the renewal evaluation completed 03/10/2020.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(c) Provide a copy of the report to any social services worker
that has children placed in the home.
Two of the three special evaluations reviewed did not include documentation the
social service worker with children placed in the home was provided a copy of the
special evaluation report. These were the same two reports previously identified.
This is a repeat noncompliance from the renewal evaluation completed
03/10/2020.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan for the renewal evaluation completed
03/10/2020. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that evaluation were R
400.1212 (3)(a), R 400.12324 (4)(b)(d), R 400.12326 (1)(c)(d)(h), and R 400.12327
(6)(b)(c). Areas identified as repeat noncompliance as a part of this interim
evaluation are R 400.12327 (6)(b)(c).
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
